fields.summary: Unable to set object storage provider during configuration, NPE in CLC log

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: Configuration variables should be available before related components are enabled

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

fields.summary: Unable to set object storage provider: 'Cannot modify objectstorage.providerclient new value is not a valid value'

comments.body: Bad UX. Let's see if we can at least throw a better error message?

[~shaon]: Spoke to [~zhill] about this issue and he asked me to check if eucalyptus-cloud service was running on the UFS host. I didn't realize that registration could succeed without eucalyptus-cloud service running on the UFS and assumed that it was. Can you tell me what in the logs - http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Calyptos/2267/consoleText indicates eucalyptus-cloud service start

[~swathi],

{{start service service\[eucalyptus-cloud\]}} indicates that that this service has been started.

from the log, it looks like the eucalyptus-cloud services on both CLC and UFS were enabled,

*UFS*
{noformat}
[10.111.1.73] out: [2015-11-05T11:00:43-08:00] INFO: service[eucalyptus-cloud] enabled
[10.111.1.73] out: 
[10.111.1.73] out:     - enable service service[eucalyptus-cloud]
[10.111.1.73] out:   * service[eucalyptus-cloud] action start[2015-11-05T11:00:43-08:00] INFO: Processing service[eucalyptus-cloud] action start (eucalyptus::user-facing line 31)
[10.111.1.73] out: [2015-11-05T11:00:48-08:00] INFO: service[eucalyptus-cloud] started
[10.111.1.73] out: 
[10.111.1.73] out:     - start service service[eucalyptus-cloud]
{noformat}

*CLC*
{noformat}
[10.111.1.5] out: [2015-11-05T10:57:08-08:00] INFO: service[eucalyptus-cloud] started
[10.111.1.5] out: 
[10.111.1.5] out:     - start service service[eucalyptus-cloud]
[10.111.1.5] out: Recipe: eucalyptus::register-components
[10.111.1.5] out:   * execute[wait-for-credentials] action run[2015-11-05T10:57:08-08:00] INFO: Processing execute[wait-for-credentials] action run (eucalyptus::register-components line 21)
[10.111.1.5] out: [2015-11-05T10:57:08-08:00] INFO: Retrying execution of execute[wait-for-credentials], 14 attempt(s) left
[10.111.1.5] out: [2015-11-05T10:57:38-08:00] INFO: Retrying execution of execute[wait-for-credentials], 13 attempt(s) left
[10.111.1.5] out: [2015-11-05T10:58:08-08:00] INFO: Retrying execution of execute[wait-for-credentials], 12 attempt(s) left
[10.111.1.5] out: [2015-11-05T10:58:38-08:00] INFO: execute[wait-for-credentials] ran successfully
[10.111.1.5] out: 
{noformat}
Here is another CI run that had the same issue http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Calyptos/2454/consoleFull

[~hspencer] - Did you notice that output from euserv-describe-services does not show any UFS endpoints? To me this meant that the UFS was not registered. [~zhill] and I looked through the system and found it in a weird state, UFS was registered and OSG was bootstrapped at some point but the current state of service configuration for all UFS endpoints is stuck in PRIMORDIAL state. I'm not sure what that means but I'm looking into it. 

{noformat}
2015-11-16 08:16:00  INFO | Using builder: OsgBuilder for: API_10.111.5.61.API_10.111.5.61.objectstorage@10.111.5.61:8773
...
2015-11-16 08:16:00  INFO | :1447690560991:Component:COMPONENT_SERVICE_REGISTERED:objectstorage:local:ServiceConfiguration objectstorage arn:euca:bootstrap:API_10.111.5.61:objectstorage:API_10.111.5.61.objectstorage/ 10.111.5.6
1:8773:/services/objectstorage:vm-local:host-local:INITIALIZED
...
2015-11-16 08:16:01 ERROR | START:DISABLED  arn:euca:bootstrap:API_10.111.5.61:objectstorage:API_10.111.5.61.objectstorage/ INITIALIZED->DISABLED=BROKEN [OSG object storage provider client not configured. Found property 'objectstorage.providerclient' empty or unset manager(null).  Legal values are: riakcs,walrus]
...
2015-11-16 08:16:01 ERROR | ENABLE:ENABLED  arn:euca:bootstrap:API_10.111.5.61:objectstorage:API_10.111.5.61.objectstorage/ BROKEN->ENABLED=BROKEN [OSG object storage provider client not configured. Found property 'objectstorage.providerclient' empty or unset manager(null).  Legal values are: riakcs,walrus]
{noformat}

[~swathi] and [~hspencer], note the startup.log for the last boot of the CLC:
{code}
  Detected Interfaces
_________________________________________________________

        lo -- [/127.0.0.1/0 [null]]
        lo -- /127.0.0.1
{code}
That's not good. It should be showing em1 there as it did in previous boots. I think that is why the services are not bootstrapped--PRIMORDIAL is the very first stage before init() is called on the services, so something failed very early in the system bootstrap here.

[~tony], [~mbacchi], I'd like to check if the failure to set the property on QA clouds is for the same reason as [~zhill]'s findings. Can we get a QA cloud that's stuck in this state or the full set of logs at least. Another thing that would be helpful is the service state output when this failure to set the property occurs. objectstorage must be in a BROKEN state before configuring any associated propertis such as providerclient. Has this issue been observed on clouds built from source?

[~zhill]: I restarted eucalyptus-cloud on [~hspencer]'s FastStart machine 10.111.5.61 and the startup.log showed em1 under Detected Interfaces

{noformat}
_________________________________________________________
  Detected Interfaces                                  
_________________________________________________________

        em1 -- [/10.111.5.61/16 [/10.111.255.255]]
        em1 -- /10.111.5.61
        lo -- [/127.0.0.1/0 [null]]
        lo -- /127.0.0.1
{noformat} 

After the restart of eucalyptus-cloud service, logs showed bootstrap of API endpoints and the describe services output contained all API endpoints
{noformat}
[root@a-19 ~]# euserv-describe-services --region @localhost

SERVICE  autoscalingbackend    eucalyptus       10.111.5.61                     enabled

SERVICE  cloudwatchbackend     eucalyptus       10.111.5.61                     enabled   
SERVICE  cluster               default          default-cc-1                    enabled   
SERVICE  compute               API_10.111.5.61  API_10.111.5.61.compute         enabled   
SERVICE  dns                   API_10.111.5.61  API_10.111.5.61.dns             enabled   
SERVICE  euare                 API_10.111.5.61  API_10.111.5.61.euare           enabled   
SERVICE  eucalyptus            eucalyptus       10.111.5.61                     enabled   
SERVICE  identity              API_10.111.5.61  API_10.111.5.61.identity        enabled   
SERVICE  imaging               API_10.111.5.61  API_10.111.5.61.imaging         enabled   
SERVICE  imagingbackend        eucalyptus       10.111.5.61                     notready  
SERVICE  jetty                 eucalyptus       10.111.5.61                     enabled   
SERVICE  loadbalancing         API_10.111.5.61  API_10.111.5.61.loadbalancing   enabled   
SERVICE  loadbalancingbackend  eucalyptus       10.111.5.61                     notready  
SERVICE  notifications         eucalyptus       10.111.5.61                     enabled   
SERVICE  objectstorage         API_10.111.5.61  API_10.111.5.61.objectstorage   broken    
SERVICE  pollednotifications   eucalyptus       10.111.5.61                     enabled   
SERVICE  reporting             bootstrap        10.111.5.61                     enabled   
SERVICE  simpleworkflow        API_10.111.5.61  API_10.111.5.61.simpleworkflow  enabled   
SERVICE  storage               default          default-sc-1                    broken    
SERVICE  tokens                API_10.111.5.61  API_10.111.5.61.tokens          enabled   
SERVICE  user-api              API_10.111.5.61  API_10.111.5.61                 enabled   
SERVICE  walrusbackend         walrus           walrus-1                        enabled   
{noformat}

I was able to configure objectstorage.providerclient property as well
{noformat}
[root@a-19 ~]# euctl objectstorage.providerclient=walrus
objectstorage.providerclient = walrus
[root@a-19 ~]# euctl objectstorage.providerclient
objectstorage.providerclient = walrus
{noformat}
This is the last time this error showed up in CI (back on Nov. 17, 2015), http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/view/%204.2%20Testing/job/Calyptos/2557/console

Summarizing the IRC discussion with [~tony]. SC state should be independent of the OSG/Walrus states. Faststart logs show Walrus registration step followed by Walrus installation step. Although the install step might not actually do anything the ordering is reversed. Fasstart also restarts the eucalyptus-cloud service and I'm not entirely sure why. In one of the failed fasstart installations, UFS services did not come up after eucalyptus-cloud restart, they were running prior to the restart. 

Faststart log snippet showing walrus installation post registration and eucalyptus-cloud restart

[~tony], have you looked into the fasstart installation any further?
EUCA-12356 fixes some bootstrap issues for 4.3 that may have meant certain errors (such as an NPE) in one component could prevent other components from bootstrapping correctly.

[~tony]: Is there a plan to produce a 4.3.0 FastStart package we can test internally to see if this problem goes away before we ship a new 4.3.0 FastStart? I see that the fastrat Jenkins job just downloads and runs the existing script from hphelion.com.

I hit the case where both "storage" (EBS) and "objectstorage" services showed "broken", in the euserv-describe-services output.

My workaround (and for anyone else having this issue in FastStart 4.2.2, and if it shows up later):

EDIT: This doesn't always work, even if you restart the eucalyptus-cloud service.

{noformat}
euctl objectstorage.providerclient=walrus
euctl default.storage.blockstoragemanager=overlay
{noformat}
Wait for euserv-describe-services "storage" and "objectstorage" services to show "enabled"

The imagingbackend and loadbalancingbackend services are still "notready", because the chef cookbook had not completed. You can stop all euca* services, edit and re-run the installer:

{noformat}
for x in /etc/init.d/euca*; do echo $x; service $(basename $x) stop; done
wget hphelion.com/eucalyptus-install
vi eucalyptus-install
{noformat}

Comment out the section that checks to see if Eucalyptus is already installed.
Then re-run the installer:

{noformat}
chmod 744 eucalyptus-install
./eucalyptus-install
{noformat}
This may be addressed by changes made for EUCA-13312.
